title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: A new report is casting doubt on claims by the Shadow Home Affairs Minister that there is a human trafficking 'crisis' at Australian airports. The government paper revealed in the 12 months to June, close to nine million people were granted temporary visas and off them, 69 were identified as being victims, but only several people affected claimed protection status. Senator Kristina Keneally claimed people smugglers changed their business model from boats to planes. But the Home Affairs Administration update refuted the claim, saying there was no evidence a large volume of air arrivals were claiming protection and being subjected to exploitation. Image: News Corp Australia
